title: Programming courses - Java, C, OCaml, HTML, JS, Node, NoSQL
description: Learn about Java, C, OCaml, Web-related languages (HTML, CSS, JS, PHP, Node) and databases-related languages (SQL, NoSQL). We also have courses about Assembly, TypeScript, Cybersecurity, and API.

e1.name: OCaml
e1.desc: OCaml may be used when you need to write a safe program (as it is a functional language). It's quite easy to learn, almost no syntax.

e1.name: Kotlin
e1.desc: Kotlin is a open-source, modern, programming language developed by JetBrains, which is also the main language used for Android applications.

e5.name: Networking
e5.desc: Learn about protocols, network interfaces, ports, IPV4/IPV6, and models such as OSI, or TCP/IP.

e2.name: Linux
e2.desc: General knowledge shared between most, if not all, Linux-based distributions such as Debian, Ubuntu, Fedora, Arch Linux...

e2.name: Linux (radix/bases)
e2.desc: This is more of a mathematical course, but you will use binaries, octal, hexadecimal numbers everywhere, as they are used by Linux.

e2.name: Linux (commands)
e2.desc: A lot of commands that can be used on Linux-based distributions, along with their most useful options, and some tips about their usage.

e2.name: Linux (networking)
e2.desc: Application of the networking course on Linux-based distributions. This is basically a list of a lot of commands.

e2.name: Linux (scripts)
e2.desc: Learn how to write Shell scripts.

e2.name: Linux on Windows
e2.desc: Knowledge related to using Linux on Windows.

Low-Level.name: System calls
Low-Level.desc: Learn about the most-used system calls.

e3.name: SQL
e3.desc: Relational databases are using SQL (89 or 92) as their query language. Since ~2011, NoSQL databases are more and more used.

e3.name: PL/SQL
e3.desc: If you want to add functions in SQL, you need to learn the Procedural Language (PL) for SQL. In PostgreSQL, this is called PL/pgSQL.

e3.name: NoSQL
e3.desc: Learn about NoSQL 'NotOnlySQL', 4 new kinds of databases which are more flexible than relational databases (such as MongoDB or Cypher).

e4.name: WEB
e4.desc: How to start, what you need to know, ... and everything that couldn't be put in a specific language course.

e4.name: HTML
e4.desc: A complete summary of what you need to know in HTML to make a website.

e4.name: CSS
e4.desc: What's CSS and how you could use it to make your website looks better.

e4.name: JavaScript
e4.desc: A short introduction to JavaScript used to make interactive websites or required for Node.js/Typescript courses.

e6.name: Android
e6.desc: Android application development using Android Studio, and Kotlin.

Cryptography.name: Crypto (basics)
Cryptography.desc: A lot of mathematical foundations allowing one's to understand more easily cryptographic algorithms.

Cryptography.name: Crypto (algorithms)
Cryptography.desc: Cryptography is the knowledge related to the encryption and decryption of messages.
